definitions.example: Climbing the mountain tested our stamina.

definitions.definition: To refine (gold, silver, etc.) in a test or cupel; to subject to cupellation.
To put to the proof; to prove the truth, genuineness, or quality of by experiment, or by some principle or standard; to try.
definitions.example: to test the soundness of a principle; to test the validity of an argument

definitions.definition: (academics) To administer or assign an examination, often given during the academic term, to (somebody).
To place a product or piece of equipment under everyday and/or extreme conditions and examine it for its durability, etc.
To be shown to be by test.
To examine or try, as by the use of some reagent.
definitions.example: to test a solution by litmus paper

definitions.definition: To attest (a document) legally, and date it.
To make a testament, or will.
The act of conducting a test; trialing, proving.
